page.title: 13Market Day in Featherstone
page.content: The market has only been open for a couple of years and is held all day Thursday on a shopping square off the main street.There are thirty stalls all with white protective weatherproof covers.The market would look more attractive if the awnings were striped or coloured.The stalls cover a wide range of goods wet fish,bakers,clocks, clothing,eggs and wool.Many of the stalls duplicate the local shops even those around the square but all the traders are pleased with level of sale Some traders also go to Pontefract and Castleford markets.In the summer it is difficult to get a stall.Some traders say they can make more cash from one day here than one in Wakefield where there is a daily market.The market attracts local people but is not an attraction to folk outside the area.
